page.title: 13 Crafts ; Papa Westray
page.content: Straw work, including the making of Orkney Chairs is a traditional craft in Papa Westray, passed from father to son. The black oat straw is first washed then sewn together in bundles. On average it takes two days to make the back in a ladies chair and about a week for a man's chair. Traditionally the frame was made of driftwood but nowadays the chair maker buys the ready made frame and then adds the back. Other items such as baskets and table mats are also made of straw. Spinning was done by the womenfolk but very little spinning is done today though there are still spinning wheels in some houses. Many women knit by hand or machine.
